unnormalised: Hey everyone, let's talk online shopping! We've all been there, right? Scrolling through endless pages, adding things to our cart, and then... the payment page. It's a digital dance between convenience and caution.
normalised: Hey everyone, let us talk online shopping! We have all been there, right? Scrolling through endless pages, adding things to our cart, and then... the payment page. It is a digital dance between convenience and caution.

unnormalised: I mean, think about it. Last week, I was eyeing this gorgeous saree online. It was listed at ₹2500, which felt like a steal. Almost clicked 'Buy Now' immediately! But then I remembered my friend, Priya, had a similar experience. She saw shoes listed for just Rs 999 on some random website. Turned out to be a scam, and she lost the money.
normalised: I mean, think about it. Last week, I was eyeing this gorgeous saree online. It was listed at rupee two thousand five hundred, which felt like a steal. Almost clicked 'Buy Now' immediately! But then I remembered my friend, Priya, had a similar experience. She saw shoes listed for just rupees nine hundred and ninety nine on some random website. Turned out to be a scam, and she lost the money.

unnormalised: So, I decided to do some digging first. I checked the website's rating – only 2.5 stars! That's a big red flag. Plus, the shipping charges were outrageous – Rs 350! Suddenly, that "steal" didn't seem so attractive anymore.
normalised: So, I decided to do some digging first. I checked the website's rating – only two point five stars! That is a big red flag. Plus, the shipping charges were outrageous – rupees three hundred and fifty! Suddenly, that "steal" did not seem so attractive anymore.

unnormalised: And the number of ads these days! You click on one thing, and suddenly your entire internet life is filled with ads for similar products. It's almost creepy. I saw a pair of earrings advertised for just ₹50 the other day. I didn't even *need* earrings, but the price was so tempting. Almost fell for it!
normalised: And the number of ads these days! You click on one thing, and suddenly your entire internet life is filled with ads for similar products. It is almost creepy. I saw a pair of earrings advertised for just rupee fifty the other day. I did not even *need* earrings, but the price was so tempting. Almost fell for it!

unnormalised: Then there’s the whole cashback game. Sites are throwing around deals like “₹100 cashback on orders above ₹500”. Makes you want to buy *more*, doesn't it? I ended up ordering a book I didn't really need just to get that cashback! Marketing, eh?
normalised: Then there is the whole cashback game. Sites are throwing around deals like “rupee one hundred cashback on orders above rupee five hundred”. Makes you want to buy *more*, does not it? I ended up ordering a book I did not really need just to get that cashback! Marketing, eh?

unnormalised: Another thing, remember to check the delivery date. I once ordered a gift for my cousin's birthday, scheduled for delivery on 12/12/2024. It arrived on 15/12/2024, three days late! Birthday surprise ruined. Always double-check, folks.
normalised: Another thing, remember to check the delivery date. I once ordered a gift for my cousin's birthday, scheduled for delivery on twelfth december two thousand and twenty four. It arrived on fifteenth december two thousand and twenty four, three days late! Birthday surprise ruined. Always double-check, folks.

unnormalised: Ultimately, shopping online in India is a mix of amazing deals and potential pitfalls. Just remember to stay vigilant, check reviews, and don’t get swayed by those tempting Rs 50 offers. Happy shopping, and stay safe!
normalised: Ultimately, shopping online in India is a mix of amazing deals and potential pitfalls. Just remember to stay vigilant, check reviews, and do not get swayed by those tempting rupees fifty offers. Happy shopping, and stay safe!
